p: Concerning CHIKV, other animal models have shown muscle involvement during infection. In a hamster model, development of myositis has been reported [ 81]; in a zebrafish model, developed for the study of the immune response, muscle was confirmed to be infected by CHIKV, although identification of the specific target cell type could not be clarified [ 82]. In addition, in a non-human primate (NHP) model, such as a macaque infected with CHIKV, viral RNA was detected in several tissues including muscle [ 83, 84].
